name: Southern Copper Corporation
description: Southern Copper Corporation (SCCO) is one of the largest integrated copper producers in the world, with a significant presence in both mining and refining operations. Founded in 1954, the company is a subsidiary of Grupo México, one of the largest mining companies in Mexico. SCCO operates mines in Peru and Mexico and is involved in the mining, smelting, and refining of copper, as well as the production of other metals such as molybdenum and silver. The company is committed to sustainable practices and has made significant investments in environmental protection and community development. With a strong portfolio of mining assets, including the Cananea and La Caridad mines, Southern Copper benefits from high-quality reserves and extensive infrastructure. The company's production capabilities position it as a key player in the global copper market, catering to the increasing demand driven by sectors such as construction, electrical, and renewable energy. Southern Copper is also focused on innovation and technological advancements to enhance productivity and reduce environmental impact. With its strong operational efficiency and commitment to sustainability, SCCO aims to continue its leadership in the copper industry while contributing to the economic development of the regions in which it operates.
